conditions.short_description: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing.
conditions.full_description: Snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing. Surface hoar has formed in most parts and can be buried during snow fall in the mountains in the next days.

area_forecast.forecast: Little snow is in the area and generally considered stable.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Not much snow is in the area and snow in the mountains is considered stable.
area_forecast.weather: Á þriðjudag gengur veður yfir landið með vaxandi sunnanátt á SV-horninu í byrjun dags og snýr í V-átt. Snjókoma til fjalla til að byrja með en rignir á láglendi. Hægviðri á miðvikudag og stöku éljagangur.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow older than this weekend is generally considered stable after a warm spell followed by freezing. Unstable wind slabs could form on Thursday, due to NE wind and snowfall. Until then, avalanches are considered unlikely. At most, sluffs could fall in very steep slopes.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow subsided and settled in the warm spell on Thursday 20.11. and got stiff and strong in the freezing temperatures that followed. Little new snow has fallen since the thaw and wind has been calm so it has not drifted. A little snowfall is expected during the next days, but real snowdrift is not expected until Thursday when NE wind with increasing snowfall is forecast. Then, unstable wind slabs may form, especially in south and west facing slopes and gullies.
area_forecast.weather: Á þriðjudagsmorgun er von á litlu úrkomubelti með SA snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu/slyddu á láglendi. Eftir það lítilsháttar él í hægum breytilegum áttum fram á fimmtudag. Gert er ráð fyrir um 10-15 cm af nýjum snjó í heildina. Á fimmtudag hvessir úr norðaustri, með snjókomu seinnipartinn.

area_forecast.forecast: The snowpack is generally considered stable and is expected to strengthen further with cooling weather from Saturday.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow in the mountains has become wet following the recent thaw across the country, but is generally considered stable. Cold weather in the last days has strengthened the snow pack.
area_forecast.weather: Á þriðjudag gengur veður yfir landið og snjóar til fjalla í sunnanátt. Hægviðri á miðvikudag og stöku éljagangur.

area_forecast.forecast: Update: Snow is generally considered stable after thaw followed by freezing but isolated unstable wind slabs may exist at high elevations, in gullies and below ridgelines, especially south-facing. Surface hoar may lead to instability in upper parts but will likely disappear during warming and rain on Tuesday. New unstable wind slabs are expected to form on Thursday due to snowfall and snowdrift from E and NE.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Small sluffs and snowball rolls were spotted in Norðfjörður Saturday 22.11, in south facing slopes close to the tops. A slab avalanche was observed in western slope on Sauðatindur (Innra Hólafjall), about 1000 m elevation. Release time is uncertain, probably in the thaw last week. A small avalanche fell in Skeiðfell north of the road Norðfjarðarvegur. South facing gully, probably released on Saturday 15.11.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Update: During the warm spell on Thursday night 21 November, the snow got wet and settled, then stiffened and strengthened once it froze again. Higher in the mountains, where the thaw had less impact, soft snow and unstable wind slabs may still be found in isolated areas, especially in south-facing gullies and below ridges. Surface hoar has been observed widely in upper parts but will likely disappear during warming and rain on Tuesday. On Thursday, new wind slabs are expected to form due to considerable snowfall and snowdrift in NE-E winds.

weather_forecast.forecast: On Tuesday, a brief low-pressure system moves across the country. It becomes warmer at lower elevations, but it will snow in the mountains throughout the country. Light winds on Wednesday, but on Thursday the next low passes through, and considerable snowfall can be expected in the mountains in the north and east.
